Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Collection of Amulets Representing Thoth, Anubis and Isis
Description: These amulets are made of faience and show different divinities: Thoth, the god of science, is represented as a human with a baboon's head, while Anubis, the god of the dead and of mummification, is shown with the head of a jackal. Both wear the short kilt and stand with the left foot forward and the hands beside the body. The collection also contains amulets of Isis, the mother goddess, represented as a woman sitting on a chair and suckling her son Horus, who is seated on her lap. Her head is crowned with the sun disk between the horns of a cow.
